# ImmersiveMediaRemotePreviewReceiver

**Class**

An observable object that helps apps handle receiving commands and data sent from an immersive media remote preview sender object.

## Declaration

```swift
class ImmersiveMediaRemotePreviewReceiver
```

## Overview

This object helps applications receiving Immersive Video over the network with the intent of rendering a preview playback.

To properly render an immersive video preview, the receiver also needs access to:

- The current [doc://com.apple.immersivemediasupport/documentation/ImmersiveMediaSupport/ImmersiveVideoFrame] to render.
- The current [doc://com.apple.immersivemediasupport/documentation/ImmersiveMediaSupport/VenueDescriptor] for rendering.
- The current [doc://com.apple.immersivemediasupport/documentation/ImmersiveMediaSupport/PresentationDescriptor] that describes one or more [doc://com.apple.immersivemediasupport/documentation/ImmersiveMediaSupport/PresentationCommand]instances active for the current frame.

## Initializers

- **init()**: Creates a preview receiver object.

## Instance Properties

- **frame**: The current remote preview of an immersive video frame.
- **presentationDescriptor**: The current remote immersive video presentation descriptor.
- **states**: The states to use for monitoring the current state of the preview receiver so the app can monitor events.
- **venueDescriptor**: The current remote immersive video venue descriptor.

## Instance Methods

- **start(connection:)**: Performs the necessary steps to start receiving remote Immersive video frames using the given network connection.
- **stop()**: Stops receiving remote immersive video frames.

## Enumerations

- **ImmersiveMediaRemotePreviewReceiver.Status**: A value that represents the status of the immersive media remote preview receiver object.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Observable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
